graph

Interface Graph


  • public interface Graph
    This interface allows to manipulate a directed or undirected graph
    Author:
    Gauchoux, Robilliard

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addEdge(Edge edge)
      Adds an edge to the graph Edge and vertices of edge must don't exist in the graph
      Edge addEdge(Vertex sourceVertex, Vertex endVertex)
      Creates a new edge, going from the source vertex to the end vertex, and returns it Both vertices must don't exist in the graph
      void addVertex(Vertex vertex)
      Adds a vertex if not already exists
      java.lang.Boolean containsEdge(Edge edge)
      Returns if the graph contains the specified edge.
      java.lang.Boolean containsEdge(Vertex sourceVertex, Vertex endVertex)
      Returns if the graph contains an edge according to a source vertex and an end vertex
      java.lang.Boolean containsVertex(Vertex vertex)
      Returns if the graph contains the specified vertex.
      Edge[] getEdges(Vertex sourceVertex, Vertex endVertex)
      Get all edges between two vertices Both vertices must exist in the graph
      Edge removeEdge(Edge edge)
      Removes the specified edge and his vertices from the graph The edge must be already in the graph
      Vertex removeVertex(Vertex vertex)
      Removes the specified vertex from the graph The vertex must be already in the graph

    • Method Detail

      • addEdge

        void addEdge(Edge edge)
        Adds an edge to the graph Edge and vertices of edge must don't exist in the graph
        Parameters:
        edge - The edge to add

      • addEdge

        Edge addEdge(Vertex sourceVertex,
           Vertex endVertex)
        Creates a new edge, going from the source vertex to the end vertex, and returns it Both vertices must don't exist in the graph
        Parameters:
        sourceVertex - The source of the edge for DirectedEdge, can be both of vertices in case of UndirectedEdge
        endVertex - The end of the edge for DirectedEdge, can be both of vertices in case of UndirectedEdge
        Returns:
        the created edge using parameters

      • addVertex

        void addVertex(Vertex vertex)
        Adds a vertex if not already exists
        Parameters:
        vertex - A vertex

      • containsEdge

        java.lang.Boolean containsEdge(Edge edge)
        Returns if the graph contains the specified edge.
        Parameters:
        edge - The edge to test
        Returns:
        True if exists, False else

      • containsEdge

        java.lang.Boolean containsEdge(Vertex sourceVertex,
                             Vertex endVertex)
        Returns if the graph contains an edge according to a source vertex and an end vertex
        Parameters:
        sourceVertex - The source vertex to test the existence of the edge
        endVertex - The end vertex to test the existence of the edge
        Returns:
        True if exists, False else

      • containsVertex

        java.lang.Boolean containsVertex(Vertex vertex)
        Returns if the graph contains the specified vertex.
        Parameters:
        vertex - The vertex to test
        Returns:
        True if exists, False else

      • getEdges

        Edge[] getEdges(Vertex sourceVertex,
              Vertex endVertex)
        Get all edges between two vertices Both vertices must exist in the graph
        Parameters:
        sourceVertex - A source vertex
        endVertex - A end vertex
        Returns:
        An array of edges

      • removeEdge

        Edge removeEdge(Edge edge)
        Removes the specified edge and his vertices from the graph The edge must be already in the graph
        Parameters:
        edge - An existing edge in the graph
        Returns:
        The removed edge

      • removeVertex

        Vertex removeVertex(Vertex vertex)
        Removes the specified vertex from the graph The vertex must be already in the graph
        Parameters:
        vertex - An existing vertex in the graph
        Returns:
        The removed vertex
